ai.summary: Black Trail is a moderate-length hike in the UK, about 12.9 km, featuring varied terrain and gentle elevation. Suitable for walkers with some experience and a steady pace; plan for several hours on the trail.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines woodland paths, grassy verges, and occasional rocky or muddy sections. Ground can be uneven with moderate elevation changes and occasional exposed or boggy patches, especially after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for changing weather and varying trail conditions. Stay on marked paths, carry a map or GPS, and let someone know your plans. Wear sturdy boots and bring warm layers, a waterproof outer layer, sufficient water, snacks, and a basic first aid kit. In dim light, bring a headlamp or flashlight; phone with emergency numbers can be useful.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are generally best for this hike in the UK; winter hikes can be muddy and weather-dependent with shorter daylight.
